conclusion: Problem setup with charges 2q and -q at vertices of a cube, point A as another vertex, and electric field E at midpoint O.
Establish a coordinate system with 2q at (0,0,0), -q at (L,L,L), and A at (L,0,0).
Calculate distance between 2q and -q as L√3.
Determine midpoint O coordinates as (L/2, L/2, L/2).
Calculate distances from O to each charge as (L√3)/2.
Calculate distances from A to each charge: L to 2q and L√2 to -q.
Calculate electric field at O due to 2q as 8kq/3L² and due to -q as 4kq/3L².
Sum electric fields at O to get total field E = 4kq/L².
Calculate electric field at A due to 2q as 2kq/L².
Calculate electric field at A due to -q as kq/2L².
Decompose field from -q into components using unit vector (0,1/√2,1/√2).
Calculate components of E_{-q} as y-component = kq/(2√2L²) and z-component = kq/(2√2L²).
Determine total field components at A: E_x = 2kq/L², E_y = kq/(2√2L²), E_z = kq/(2√2L²).
Calculate magnitude of electric field at A as E_A = kq/L² * √(17/4).
Express E_A in terms of E: E_A = E√17/8.
Final answer: The magnitude of the electric field strength at point A is E_A = E√17/8.
